channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Europe faces a summer of diaper and tampon shortages as new EU deforestation laws threaten to disrupt the $3.5 billion industry
item.description: The Union aims to slash 10% of global deforestation through its new law which is impacting manufacturers such as P&G and Kimberly-Clark.

item.title: Number of millionaires to soar globally but plunge in the UK, research finds
item.description: The 2024 Global Wealth Report from UBS forecasts a continued increase in the number of millionaires, with the U.K. a notable outlier.

item.title: Immigration surge bolstered economy, generated little inflation, Fed study finds
Stranded by sanctions: 53 Russian oil tankers are currently drifting empty and idle across the globe
item.description: The vessels have become inactive after being hit with U.S., U.K. and European sanctions.

item.title: Wednesday's analyst calls: Eli Lilly gets a price target increase, Goldman sees Tesla decline
item.description: Tesla and a pharmaceutical giant were among the stocks analysts were talking about on Wednesday.

item.title: Taiwan Semi's quarterly sales exceed estimates
‘All workers deserve a union’: Ride-hailing drivers in Massachusetts are advancing a first-of-its-kind ballot question to gain union rights
item.description: April Verritt, president of the Service Employees International Union, said the tens of thousands of Uber and Lyft drivers working in Massachusetts deserve the collective bargaining benefits of unions.

item.title: Volkswagen shares slip as it considers Brussels plant closure on weak EV demand
item.description: Volkswagen shares dipped after the company issued an overnight profit warning and announced it was considering the potential closure of an Audi plant.

item.title: Maker of F-35A missiles has seen shares double this year
Sicily’s summer drought is so acute this year that it’s drying up lakes and forcing cities to turn away tourists because they don’t have enough water
item.description: Climate change is hurting the Italian island of Sicily in various ways—from record-high heat and shrinking water reserves.

item.title: TSMC second-quarter revenue jumps on AI boost, handily beats market forecasts
item.description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co, whose customers include Apple and Nvidia, has benefited from the surge towards AI.

item.title: Investors should focus on why Fed cuts rates, not when: fixed-income strategist
NATO needs help reaching Gen Z so is turning to 20-something TikTok and Instagram influencers from the U.K. and Europe to stay relevant
item.description: Aging institutions like NATO increasingly need to think outside the box to bolster public support.

item.title: China is leading on GenAI experimentation, but lags U.S. in implementation, survey shows
item.description: Chinese companies lead the world in general generative AI use but are still behind the U.S. in full implementation, a new survey finds.

item.title: Big-box retailer Target will stop accepting paper checks this month
